rev.comment: /* Print and online media */ suspended by host
/* Print and online media */ Add AA article, and fix wikilinks
/* Health and Safety */ simplify and remove implication that these are all serious, all common, or all specific to zoophilia
/* Health and Safety */ clarify relative rarity, especially for anaphylaxis as a result of animal hair allergy which is possible but seems extremely rare.

Don't delete whole chunks of info, while its still being discussed on the talk page, please. Thanks.

/* Religious perspectives */ Reinstate islam. See Talk Page. Please do not remove entire sections without considering what is in them and what the sources cited actually say.

rmv more implied or incorrect info - "law" cannot in fact be generalized as many countries it's legal, "in society" is implicit anyhow.
rvt excessive point-making (as before) -- A fuller list of objections is given elsewhere, all the points added are implied within existing wording.
rvt deleted information that research is broadly supportive -- Hartley, stop deleting valid information.
New version of intro paragraphs. Please don't revert without discussing first.
making adjustments according to Raul's suggestions (his talkpage)
NPOVing the article opening. Removed argumentative phrasing/arrangements, and increased the knowledge level.
change disambig template from Otheruse to Otheruses1
reverted change by Zver - the link is not relevant for the article, please stop adding it

Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/89.178.126.76|89.178.126.76]] ([[User talk:89.178.126.76|talk]]) to last version by FT2
rmv duplicate about research being "broadly supportive". No need to emphasize zoophiles position excessively. Its mentioned quite adequately previously.
Rmv limiting statement that debate is only "in psychology". The debate is outside psychology too, obviously, since it was raised within philosophy and by zoophiles, to name two non-psychology groups.
Rvt sentence order in intro (was changed for POV). "Critics" are often not experts. Experts in *zoophilia* are those who actually studied *zoophilia* and seem to have a near unanimous consensus.
rework last sentence -- the statement that "critics say it should be illegal" is as unnecessary in the intro as a view that "defenders say it should be legal".
fix typo, remove further duplication ("unethical" includes "coercive", "to prevent animal abuse" is inherent in ""always abusive or unethical"), and reinstate deleted criticism
rmv duplication ("immoral" duplicated "crime against nature"), and redundant wording "in law and society". Law is covered, for now all we need say in intro is it is "often condemned".

reinstate "far" (accurate description), rvt POV change that research only "exists" (in fact this is the consensus view in psych rsrch, critics are outside the field), rmv POV insert "like pedophilia".
rvt JHartley intro re Singer -- its some, including Singer. Not just Singer.
rework opening a bit, and fix references.
removed argumentative phrasing, placed simple statements with citations. See discussion

removing arguments, removing "there is debate" (society is undecided???) and placing the more solid statements more correctly
